verses.verse: [To the chiefe musition, a psalme of Dauid.] God heare thee in the day of trouble: the name of the Lorde of Iacob defende thee.
Let him sende thee helpe from the sanctuarie: and ayde thee out of Sion.
Let him remember all thy offeringes: and turne into asshes thy burnt sacrifices. Selah.
Let him graunt thee thy heartes desire: and accomplishe all thy deuice.
We wyll reioyce in thy saluation, and triumph in the name of our Lorde: for God wyll perfourme all thy petitions.
Nowe I knowe that God wyll saue his annoynted, he wyll heare him from his heauenly sanctuarie: there is saluation in the mightinesse of his right hande.
Some [put their trust] in chariotes, and some in horses: but we wyll remember the name of God our Lorde.
They shalbe made to bowe and fall: but we shall arise, and stande vpright.
Saue thou O God: that the king may heare vs in the day when we call.
